meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impudent; insolence or rudeness.
meanings.sent1: Her impudency in class was evident when she talked back to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: His impudency towards his elders was unacceptable.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's impudency in stealing nuts from the bird feeder was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The impudency of the storm as it raged through the town was overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The impudency of the toddler as he demanded more cookies was both bold and amusing.

meanings.definition: An instance of impudent behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: The child's impudency towards his parents shocked everyone at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe the impudency of the salesman who tried to scam her.
meanings.sent3: The cat's impudency in stealing the dog's bed made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The impudency of the car alarm blaring in the quiet neighborhood was irritating.
meanings.sent5: The impudency of the politician's lies left the audience speechless.
